main event: A bright, luminous object was observed in the sky near Danville, Illinois on April 22, 1962.
interesting points: The object appeared to be circular or possibly spherical in shape, and was approximately twice the size of Venus.
The object was opaque and luminous, about half as bright as Venus.
The object was observed through binoculars and could also be seen with the naked eye.
The object appeared to be rising in elevation and changing direction sharply at one point.
The sighting was made by a civilian witness who was a photo finisher and amateur astronomer.
sighted object: a bright, luminous, circular or spherical object
witnesses: a civilian photo finisher and amateur astronomer
